result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ciera C. Wakeen

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 2:26 pm
INCLUDES 22CM1047 & 22CF1282.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence in person for ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Jack Mathie in person.
VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on the Misdemeanor File. 

BOND: 
$500.00 Signature Bond to cover both files.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): St. Paul's Church; Open Door; A.V.; J.J.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Not Possess any Spray Paint.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PTC 11/21/2022 @ 11:15 am
FPT 12/22/2022 @ 2:15 pm
JT 02/14/2023 @ 9:00 am

Branch 4 Files

Adjourned: 2:30 pm
